info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 22 at 2:24AM EDT until August 22 at 5:30AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of piedmont North Carolina, including the following counties, Gaston and Mecklenburg.
* WHEN...Until 530 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 222 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. Rainfall trends indicate the need for a Flood Advisory, especially for urban areas. An upgrade to a Flash Flood Warning is possible if conditions continue to worsen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Gastonia, Charlotte, Huntersville, West Concord, Mt Holly, Davidson, Belmont, Harrisburg, Stanley, Cramerton, Lowell, Ranlo, Mcadenville and Paw Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via X using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
